column4: I think I have forgotten the semantics of the +w flag for the group when it comes to directories. If the +w flag is set for a directory, then any member belonging to the group should be able to write to the directory right?
However I find that any user of the group cannot write to the directory
Does the family group have the execute flag for the directory?
execute-flag is used to permit browsing on directories
ah okay! I think I got it. thanks everyone :)
er, I have set drwxrwxr-x for the shared directory
and I belong to the family group
and I cant move stuff from /home/myhome to /home/data which has  drwxrwxr-x
This is funny. Would it have something to do with AppArmor or something ?
not sure.... I'm not well versed in the workings of apparmor
okay ... thanks! Ill try some more stuff to see if it works
